intro: Elattostachys duplicatoserrata, commonly known as the double-toothed elattostachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves with doubly serrated margins. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
